reviewText: Interesting as we are collecting Stephen King movies since we spent our honeymoon at the Stanley Hotel.
I love the movies ! It takes me back to my youth!

I've watched the movie Silver Bullet dozens of times online and wanted to purchase the DVD so I ordered it from Amazon since the price was very reasonable for two movies!! I've never seen Graveyard Shift so I was happy to have it included. The overall quality of the DVD was great! Sound and picture were just as they should be and I received my items in just 2 days from original order date.. I'm still a happy customer of Amazon:-)

I have always been a fan of these 2 movies, particularly Silver Bullet, but Graveyard Shift is solid too. I remember watching Silver Bullet as a kid and it was one of the first movies that got me into monsters / werewolves back then. Very simple story line yet well acted and done. Same for Graveyard Shift, cant go wrong with this combo!

One of my  wife's and mine favorite movie "graveyard shift ". I could almost watch that movie 365. I also like when you get more than one movie on a DVD.
.

This is a great Stephen King entry that is made a bit more macabre knowing that the poor kid in the wheelchair,
actually, HAS passed into the nethermost netherworld. Corey's life gave NEW meaning to lost boys and silver-
bullets.
I recommend T-H-I-S double feature---until a Blu-ray comes out---over the single; triple; and quad-feature DVD-
versions.
What a great werewolf movie... with a few extra twists and turns.

Silver Bullet
I remember watching this as a kid and it scared me so much that I can't watch any movie with werewolves.  Well, I still can't.  I got halfway through and turned it off.  Apparently childhood fears took over and that night I had nightmares.  (How embarrassing!)
Graveyard Shift
I also watched it as a kid but was then 5 years older.  I didn't find it nearly as scary, as an adult I'm not impressed with the story and I wonder if they changed parts of the original book.  Watch it but don't expect it to keep you on the edge of your seat.

I had a hard time rating it, Graveyard Shift would have probably only gotten 3 stars, Silver Bullet had the childish fear factor.  I went ahead and gave it 4 stars.  Maybe in another 30 years I can attempt Silver Bullet again!

Guy M.  Word 300
Twenty and Fourteen Guy
Disposable Copy

The Sequels of Stephen King

by

M. M.

  Stephen King has written many sequels.  Big Wheels: a Tale of the Laundry Game (Milkman # 2), The Way Station, The Slow Mutants, The Gunslinger and the Dark Man, The Dark Tower II: the Drawing of the Three, The Dark Tower III: the Wastelands and Wizard and Glass to name a few.  There are also The Regulators and Desperation.  There is also, what I like to call the Castle Rock stories.
  Nona, Cujo, The Sun Dog, The Body, The Dark Half, Sleepwalkers, Needful Things and It Grows on You.  The Breathing Method is a sequel to The Man who Would Not Shake Hands.  Stephen King once wrote a sequel to the Cthulhu mythos.  One for the Road is a sequel to Salems Lot.
  Nevertheless, Stephen King didn't write all of his own sequels.  In 92, they wrote Pet Sematary Two.  Then they made Children of the Corn II: the Final Sacrifice.  Then there came Children of the Corn III: Urban Harvest.
  Then there came Sometimes They Come Back Again.  Then there was Children of the Corn IV: the Gathering.  Then there is The Rage: Carrie 2.  Finally, there is Children of the Corn V: Field of Terror, Children of the Corn 666 and Children of the Corn (2009) the remake maybe don't you think?  Yes; course there is!!

---30---
